required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between Alignment of Lower Limb and Clinical Outcome After Total Knee Prosthesis.
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation Between Alignment of Lower Limb and Clinical Outcome After Total Knee Prosthesis.

brief_summary.textblock:
Evaluation of the clinical results after total knee prosthesis, and correlation with the alignment of the lower limb.
Radiological measurements by means of 3D technology will be performed. The clinical result will be stipulated by means of standardized questionnaires (KOOS, KSS and Oxford knee score-questionnaire).

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical results after total knee prosthesis with standardized questionnaires after 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Standardized questionnaires (KOOS KSS en Oxford knee score-questionnaire).

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical results after total knee prosthesis with standardized questionnaires after 12 months.
primary_outcome.description: Standardized questionnaires (KOOS KSS en Oxford knee score-questionnaire).

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical results after total knee prosthesis with standardized questionnaires after 24 months.
primary_outcome.description: Standardized questionnaires (KOOS KSS en Oxford knee score-questionnaire).

secondary_outcome.measure: Alignment of lower limb, slope of lateral and medial tibial plateau, femoral slope.

arm_group.description: Patients that undergo a total knee prosthesis.

intervention.intervention_name: patients that undergo a total knee prosthesis

study_pop.textblock: People who have osteoarthritis of the knee joint and receive a total knee prosthesis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with osteoarthritis of the knee joint, without severe bone deformation
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
